intro: Utricularia erectiflora, commonly known as the erect-flowered bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves that form bladders used to trap and digest small aquatic organisms. This species typically grows in shallow, nutrient-poor water bodies, where it relies on its specialized structures for nutrient acquisition. The plant produces upright, slender inflorescences with small, greenish-white flowers. Utricularia erectiflora is an epiphytic or aquatic plant, often found in regions with high humidity and abundant water sources.
